Duterte to carefully study options on Luzon-wide quarantine --Palace tag:gmanetwork.com:news_story-735153 https://www.gmanetwork.com/news/news/nation/735153/duterte-to-carefully-study-options-on-luzon-wide-quarantine-palace/story/ President Rodrigo Duterte will “carefully” study his options before making a decision on the fate of the Luzon-wide enhanced community quarantine, Malacañang said Wednesday. Philippines gets P269M from US for fight vs. COVID-19 tag:gmanetwork.com:news_story-735151 https://www.gmanetwork.com/news/news/nation/735151/philippines-gets-p269m-from-us-for-fight-vs-covid-19/story/ Washington has approved an additional P269 million or about $5.3 million aid to the Philippines to support its coronavirus response operations, its embassy in Manila said Wednesday. Wed, 22 Apr 2020 17:21:53 +0800
Solon proposes Monday to Wednesday, Thursday to Saturday class shifts next school year tag:gmanetwork.com:news_story-735149 https://www.gmanetwork.com/news/news/nation/735149/solon-proposes-monday-to-wednesday-thursday-to-saturday-class-shifts-next-school-year/story/ A lawmaker is proposing that classes next school year be held in shifts -- from Mondays to Wednesdays and Thursdays to Saturdays --in areas that would still be under quarantine to prevent the spread of COVID-19. Wed, 22 Apr 2020 17:14:31 +0800

Wed, 22 Apr 2020 17:02:01 +0800
Cayetano: Mga bangko, dapat pautangin ang MSMEs, mga magsasaka para makabangon sa apektado ng pandemic tag:gmanetwork.com:news_story-735146 https://www.gmanetwork.com/news/news/ulatfilipino/735146/cayetano-mga-bangko-dapat-pautangin-ang-msmes-mga-magsasaka-para-makabangon-sa-apektado-ng-pandemic/story/ Para makabangon mula sa epekto ng coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) pandemic ang micro, small and medium-scale enterprises (MSMEs), at mga magsasaka, hinikayat ni Speaker Alan Peter Cayetano ang pamahalaan at mga bangko na magpautang sa mga ito at gawing simple ang paraan. Wed, 22 Apr 2020 16:55:45 +0800

Wed, 22 Apr 2020 16:47:54 +0800

Philippines COVID-19 cases rise to 6,710, recovered patients now 693 tag:gmanetwork.com:news_story-735131 https://www.gmanetwork.com/news/news/nation/735131/philippines-cases-rise-to-6-710-recovered-patients-now-693/story/ The number of patients who have recovered from the coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) climbed to 693 on Wednesday after the Department of Health (DOH) reported 39 new recoveries as cases nationwide rose to 6,710 with 111 new infections. Nine more patients have also succumbed to the respiratory illness, bringing the death toll to 446. Wed, 22 Apr 2020 16:36:19 +0800

Pasig City Mayor Vico Sotto said at a virtual presser hosted by the Foreign Correspondents Association of the Philippines. Wed, 22 Apr 2020 16:11:28 +0800

COVID-19 cases in Cebu capital jump to 312, with 139 new ones, mostly from city jail tag:gmanetwork.com:news_story-735132 https://www.gmanetwork.com/news/news/regions/735132/covid-19-cases-in-cebu-capital-jump-to-312-with-139-new-ones-mostly-from-city-jail/story/ The total coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) infections in Cebu City rose to 312 on Wednesday after the local government reported 139 new cases, majority of whom were from the Cebu City Jail.
